snippet: The Republican candidate, David Jolly, defeated the Democrat, Alex Sink, to fill a congressional seat on Florida’s Gulf Coast.
abstract: Former lobbyist David Jolly wins Florida special election for House seat in hotly contested swing district of Pinellas County; defeats Democrat Alex Sink, giving Republican Party an expensive triumph in its battle for control of Congress.

byline.contributor: Arielle Stevenson contributed reporting from Largo, Fla., and Jonathan Martin from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Republican candidate, David Jolly, defeated the Democrat, Alex Sink, to fill a congressional seat on Florida’s Gulf Coast.

headline.main: Victory in Florida Race Bolsters Midterm Hopes for Republicans
headline.print_headline: Victory in Florida Race Bolsters Midterm Hopes for Republicans
